title: 105_hr4653
content: The "Medicare HMO Improvement Act of 1998" extends the initial Medicare+Choice contract period to 3 years and allows for the authority to delay termination. Section 1851(g)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow the Secretary to delay the termination of a Medicare+Choice plan for up to 1 year if it poses a serious health risk or reduces plan availability in the area. The Secretary can delay the termination of a Medicare+Choice plan for up to 1 year if it poses a serious health risk or reduces plan availability in the area. The delay can be ended if an adequate provider network is established to provide equal insurance coverage. SEC. 4. RESTRICTION ON TERMINATION OF MEDICARE+CHOICE PLANS IN SELECTED AREAS WITHIN A METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA. The amendment to Section 1857(c) of the Social Security Act limits the selective termination of Medicare+Choice contracts in specific areas within a metropolitan statistical area. The Secretary can terminate a contract with a Medicare+Choice organization if coverage is terminated in a part of the area, unless an exception is granted due to imminent risks. The amendment allows for the termination of Medicare+Choice contracts in specific areas within a metropolitan statistical area if there is an imminent and serious health risk to enrollees. The effective date for these amendments is upon enactment of the Act. SEC. 5. CONTINUITY OF CARE IN CASE OF INVOLUNTARY TERMINATION. Continuity of care is ensured for individuals whose enrollment with a Medicare+Choice plan is terminated by the organization, as long as they are in a course of treatment covered by the plan. The organization must continue coverage for the treatment for 90 days after the termination date. The amendment ensures continuity of care for individuals in a covered course of treatment for 90 days after termination of a Medicare+Choice plan. The coverage must be under the same terms and conditions as before termination. The amendment applies to contracts entered into or renewed after the effective date. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to contracts entered into or renewed on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
